sense.name: the act of chuckling, laughing
sense.examples: The comedian's joke got a few laughs from the audience. A maniacal laugh issued forth now and again from the attic of the old house. The child ignored the laughs of his classmates and continued his piano solo. Santa Claus gave a big belly laugh as he put presents under the tree.

sense.name: a manner of facial expression, a smile
sense.examples: The lips on the Venetian mask were curled into a laugh. The clown mimed a silent laugh as he performed for the children.

sense.name: a source or cause of derision
sense.examples: So John claims he invented the Internet? That's a laugh! It's such a laugh that, after all her vicious gossiping, she's now the center of that scandal.

sense.name: an amusement, something fun
sense.examples: We had a lot of laughs together in college. She decided to play along with him for a laugh. The movie is a laugh a minute.
